required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Disease Activity With Long Term Natalizumab Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: MRI and Clinical Disease Activity in Patients Treated Long Term With Natalizumab

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to retrospectively investigate the proportion of participants free of new or enlarging fluid-attenuated inversion recovery (FLAIR) lesions over time in approximately 300 Relapsing-Remitting Multiple Sclerosis (RRMS) participants with regular MRI follow-up, who have received natalizumab ≥24 month from two different observational cohorts: 1) approximately 230 participants from the Czech Republic; and 2) approximately 70 participants from Belgium. The secondary objectives of this study are as follows: Brain volume change by various measures; Changes in the number and volume of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) lesions; No evidence of disease activity (NEDA) with and without brain volume change.

detailed_description.textblock: Natalizumab will not be provided to participants by Biogen as a part of this study. Participants will remain on natalizumab therapy as prescribed by their physician.

primary_outcome.measure: Change over time in the number of participants free of new or enlarging FLAIR lesions
primary_outcome.description: Lesions that are ≥5 mm per scan (slice thickness 3 mm) as assessed by semiautomatic lesion count (by the Icometrix algorithm).

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized brain volume change rate as assessed by % change in brain parenchymal fraction [BPF]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized brain volume change rate as assessed by percent brain volume change [PBVC]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized brain volume change rate as assessed by white matter [WM] and gray matter [GM] atrophy)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative number of new ≥6-month confirmed T1-hypointense lesions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized T1-hypointense and FLAIR lesion volume change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative percent change in T1-hypointense and FLAIR lesion volume
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative number of ≥6-month-confirmed T1-hypointense lesions arising from new on- treatment Gadolinium (Gd+)-enhancing lesions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4
secondary_outcome.description: No relapse and no ≥6-month confirmed Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) progression and no new or enlarging FLAIR lesions and no new Gd+-enhancing lesions

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of total participants and 4-year completers with NEDA as measured by clinical measures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4
secondary_outcome.description: No relapse and no ≥6-month confirmed EDSS progression and no new or enlarging FLAIR lesions and no new Gd+-enhancing lesions, brain volume change rate as assessed by PBVC

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of total participants and 4-year completers with NEDA as measured by radiological measures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4
secondary_outcome.description: No new or enlarging FLAIR lesions and no new Gd+-enhancing lesions

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with brain volume loss ≤0.2% and ≤0.4%
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post long term treatment with natalizumab (>2 years) through Year 4

arm_group.description: Approximately 230 participants with RRMS receiving commercial natalizumab in Czech Republic
Approximately 70 participants with RRMS receiving commercial natalizumab in Belgium

intervention.description: Participants with RRMS receiving commercial natalizumab in Belgium and Czech Republic

study_pop.textblock: Participants who have been receiving treatment with natalizumab for ≥24 months.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of RRMS.
- Continuous treatment with natalizumab of ≥24 months. In case of a treatment interruption from natalizumab ≥60 days after a total treatment period of ≥24 months, only the treatment prior to the interruption will be analyzed. Any data after this treatment interruption (even if the patient restarts natalizumab) will not be analyzed/collected.
- ≥1 MRI scan of sufficient quality for reliable measurement.
- Baseline MRI scan ≤6 month prior to natalizumab treatment acquired.
- ≥1 MRI scan of sufficient quality for reliable measurement taken while on natalizumab treatment for ≥6 months.
- EDSS ≤ 6.5.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Anti-natalizumab antibody detection.
- Prior treatment with alemtuzumab.
- Prior treatment with mitoxantrone within 12 months of the first infusion of natalizumab.
NOTE: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.
